product_overview: A premium, responsive Next.js landing site for an AI-powered travel planning product that highlights benefits, features, pricing and enables business inquiries via a validated contact modal. The site emphasizes polished animations, smooth scrolling, and conversion-focused CTAs.
core_goals: Communicate product value clearly and persuasively to drive sign-ups and business inquiries.
Deliver a high-performance, responsive, and accessible frontend using TypeScript and Tailwind CSS.
Provide an engaging, polished experience with smooth scrolling and animations (Lenis, GSAP) to showcase the app mockups and features.
Ensure reliable client-side form validation and state management for contact inquiries using Zod and Zustand.
Make content easy to maintain and testable with component-based structure and type-safe code.
key_features: Sticky responsive Navbar with mobile hamburger menu and prominent contact inquiry CTA (components/layout/Navbar.tsx).
Hero section with animated app mockup, primary CTAs and entrance animations (components/sections/Hero.tsx).
Problem and Solution sections that explain travel planning pain points and present the AI-driven solution with a timeline mockup (components/sections/Problem.tsx, components/sections/Solution.tsx).
Features grid and a 3-step How It Works guide to explain core capabilities and workflow (components/sections/Features.tsx, components/sections/HowItWorks.tsx).
Pricing plans and accordion-style FAQ to support conversions and reduce friction (components/sections/Pricing.tsx, components/sections/FAQ.tsx).
Contact Modal form with client-side Zod validation and global state management via Zustand for open/close and submission flow (components/ui/ContactModal.tsx, lib/store.ts).
Global smooth scrolling behavior implemented with Lenis (components/layout/SmoothScroller.tsx).
Animations and scroll-triggered effects implemented using GSAP for polished transitions and mockup interactions.
Accessible, responsive layouts built with Tailwind CSS and type-safe components in TypeScript. Also uses Lucide React for icons and Zod for validation.
user_flow_summary: Landing: Visitor arrives on homepage — Hero is prominent with animated mockup and two primary CTAs (e.g., Learn more, Contact).
Navigation: User uses sticky Navbar to jump to sections or opens mobile menu to navigate; contact inquiry CTA available in header.
Explore: User scrolls through Problem → Solution → Features → How It Works, experiencing scroll-triggered animations and timeline/mockup interactions.
Pricing & FAQ: User reviews subscription plans and expands accordion FAQ items for details and objections.

Contact Inquiry: User clicks Contact CTA (header or hero) — Contact Modal opens, user fills form, client-side Zod validation runs, state managed through Zustand. On successful validation the form triggers the configured submission flow (e.g., send to API endpoint or display success state).
Mobile Behavior: Full feature parity on mobile — hamburger toggles nav, modal and accordions are touch-friendly, smooth scroll behavior degrades gracefully if unsupported.
validation_criteria: Component presence: All listed components exist and import correctly (Navbar, Hero, Problem, Solution, Features, HowItWorks, Pricing, FAQ, ContactModal, SmoothScroller).
Responsiveness: Layouts and components render correctly across breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop) — visual QA and responsive snapshot tests pass.
Accessibility: Semantic HTML, proper ARIA attributes for interactive components (hamburger, modal, accordion), and keyboard operability verified (axe-core or equivalent audit).

Form validation: ContactModal enforces Zod schema rules; invalid inputs display clear inline errors and valid submissions clear errors and change to success state. Unit tests cover the schema and form component behaviors.
Global state: Zustand store toggles modal state predictably; state transitions covered by unit tests and manual QA.

Smooth scrolling & animations: Lenis-driven scroll behavior is smooth and non-janky on modern browsers; GSAP animations trigger at expected scroll positions. Performance testing ensures animations do not cause jank (frame drops within acceptable thresholds).
Navigation & mobile menu: Hamburger opens/closes menu reliably and navigation links scroll to anchors; mobile menu accessibility and focus management pass manual tests.

Pricing & FAQ interactions: Accordion entries expand/collapse with animation and maintain content visibility for screen readers. Pricing cards render and CTA buttons are clickable with correct targets.
Performance budgets: Core Web Vitals within acceptable thresholds for a marketing landing page (LCP, FID/INP, CLS goals — team to define exact thresholds).
E2E flows: Critical user journeys (navigate to hero, open contact modal, submit form with valid data) pass end-to-end tests (Playwright/Cypress).
Type safety & linting: TypeScript compile passes with no errors; code meets linting and formatting rules.
Deployment readiness: Build succeeds in CI, no blocking TypeScript errors, and preview deployment demonstrates all visual and interactive features.
